description: LongCalc Arbitrary Precision Float and Complex Number Library
releaseNotes: This revision reverses the unfortunate implementation of a very slow low-level routine which occurred in version 0.2.1.0. In addition, checks are included in this version to throw an error in the possible event of overflow or underflow of the Int32 exponent field in the bf object. This permits the removal of compiler-included code that checked for all overflows or underflows, possible or not. These changes together result in efficiencies which reduce the run time of most function calculations by a factor of about 10 over version 0.2.1.0.
summary: This library, built with and accessible by Visual Studio (2017) and using Mpir.net for the underlying integer math, supplies a variety of math functions and utilities with precisions at least as large as 2,000,000 base 10 digits. The underlying objects are bf (for 'big float' real values comprised of an mpz_t extended integer part from Mpir.net and a base 2 int32 exponent), bcr (for complex numbers expressed in the rectangular coordinates of a bf real part and a bf imaginary part), and bcp (for complex numbers expressed in the polar coordinates of a bf radius and a bf angle). Functions supported include real and complex versions of: basic arithmetic, trigonometric functions, log and exponential functions, hyperbolic functions and the inverses of all of these, base conversions between bases up to 64, conversions between rectangular and polar coordinates, and some special functions such as Euler, Bernoulli, Gamma, Zeta, and BesselJ.
title: LongCalc Arbitrary Precision Float and Complex Number Library
